author: Staff Reporter
text:
The City Municipal Corporation had on Thursday cancelled four sub-clauses in the resolutions that were passed during the council meeting held on February 29.

The corporation had recently passed resolutions to hike the license fee and service charges for various production activities within the corporation limits. Under resolution number 3, sub-clause 2 mentioned that service fee was hiked for manufacturing ammunitions, while sub-clause 3 says that charge was fixed at Rs. 8,000 for manufacturing arrack. Also, sub-clause 7 says that beer manufacturing was permitted, while sub-clause 113 said that manufacturing of alcohol and alcoholic items would be allowed. This caused uproar among the residents as the corporation went on a damage control method on Thursday.

Addressing the media, Mayor S. Soundappan said that the items given in four clauses wee removed and fresh resolutions were sent to the Commissioner of Municipal Administration, Chennai. He said that during the DMK regime in 2008, those resolutions were passed and the manufacturing of above items was not allowed in the corporation limits. He said that the all the items were mentioned from the Public Health Act, 1939 and they continue to be banned in the corporation limits.
title: Controversial clauses removed
